solution_line_template: The total discount of a pair of shoes is ${shoe_price} x {discount_percentage} = $<<{shoe_price}*{discount_percentage}={shoe_discount}>>{shoe_discount}.
He spent ${shoe_price} - ${shoe_discount} = $<<{shoe_price}-{shoe_discount}={shoes_cost_after_discount}>>{shoes_cost_after_discount} for a pair of shoes.
The total cost of two shirts is ${shirt_price_each} x {num_shirts} = $<<{shirt_price_each}*{num_shirts}={total_shirts_cost}>>{total_shirts_cost}.
The initial cost of his purchase is ${shoes_cost_after_discount} + ${total_shirts_cost} = $<<{shoes_cost_after_discount}+{total_shirts_cost}={initial_purchase_cost}>>{initial_purchase_cost}.

He got an additional ${initial_purchase_cost} x {additional_discount_percentage} = $<<{initial_purchase_cost}*{additional_discount_percentage}={additional_discount_amount}>>{additional_discount_amount} discount upon checkout.

Therefore, Erwan spent ${initial_purchase_cost} - {additional_discount_amount} = $<<{initial_purchase_cost}-{additional_discount_amount}={final_spent_amount}>>{final_spent_amount} after all the discounts.
